comment: Nice person. Good stories. Great teacher. Long papers.
Dr. Clune CARES about what he teaches and it shows. He is very passionate about what he teaches. I really enjoyed his class and would recommend him.

Easy class, all multiple choice exams, comprehensive final.Study the multiple choice in the book and get the study guide and you will do fine.He tells  good stories but doesn't really add anything to the class as far a material goes.I got a 'B' but I was just being lazy.
Great professor and always willing to help with projects and assignment. follow his instruction and you will be fine.
Great professor,easy to understand,gives helpful test reviews,shares "real life" experience.

hes very nice and will help you with whatever you need. 3 tests and thats it. not a very interesting class. a lot of material on each test but most of the questions are definition/concept. i would recommend him. i took greenwell before and had to drop bc he was such a jerk. clune is 100x better.
this class is easy if you study the outlines and read the book.  The lectures are boring and he rambles on alot.  There are only 3 tests and thats the grade.  Definately recommended.

I took his class in summer, and I didn't learn anything. He doesn't teach how to make entries at all. He just goes over PowerPoint which is very boring slides. (just black and white slides). All tests are multiple choice.  I don't recommend taking his class if you want to learn something.

Very nice professor. Wants students in the class to succeed. Yet, he does not explain the material as thoroughly as required to do well on exams, and really get a good grasp on the material. If you can study on your own, he gives a good outline before every exam. Study the items on the outline and you will do great on the exams. Comprehensive final

A good teacher but tends to go on & on about ideas and experiences (very boring).  Doesn't require attendance, homework, or quizes just three tests and a final.  He gives great "heads up outlines" before tests.  If you show up and study the "heads up", you should do well and pass the class.
No projects, just tests and in-class quizzes he gives you the answers to. Brings in interesting outside materials and does a good job explaining concepts. I learned a lot about business in general.
Never went to class and got a B, wierd... He is a good teacher, just redundant.
